thread.title: Kos believes that Serbia will meet the requirements for opening cluster 3
thread.title_full: Kos believes that Serbia will meet the requirements for opening cluster 3

author: @Vijestime
title: Kos believes that Serbia will meet the requirements for opening cluster 3
text:
European Union (EU) Enlargement Commissioner Marta Kos expressed her belief on January 9 that Serbia will fulfill the requirements for opening Cluster 3 as part of the accession negotiations for EU membership.
"I believe that Serbia will fulfill all the requirements for the opening of Cluster 3," Marta Kos wrote on the X network after a conversation with the Minister of European Integration of Serbia, Tanja Miščević.
The commissioner added that she had a "very honest and concrete conversation about Serbia's accession to the EU" with the minister.
"Enlargement is a whole social process, which includes the opposition, civil society, the economy and other areas," added Marta Kos.
Cluster 3 includes eight chapters, five of which were opened before the cluster concept was introduced: Economic and Monetary Policy (Chapter 17), Entrepreneurship and Industrial Policy (20), Science and Research (25), Education and Culture (26) and Customs Union (29). Three chapters await the opening: Information Society and Media (10), Tax Policy (16) and Social Policy and Employment (19).
Serbia started negotiations on EU accession in January 2014, and in the past three years it has not opened a single chapter or cluster. In order to open a cluster, a unanimous decision of all EU member states is required.
In December 2024, votes against the opening of Cluster 3 came from several countries, such as the Netherlands, Scandinavian and Baltic states.
The Council of the EU said in December that the opening of Cluster 3 with Serbia will be taken into account after the country makes significant progress in the field of the rule of law, that is, in chapters 23 and 24, as well as in the process of normalizing relations with Kosovo.
